post.body: v true. & wot r yr thoughts re - if a media org writes about a particular company/assoc, shld they link to them? some do some dont
yes it's easy & a hyperlinked word doesnt need to be intrusive. i think the reasons for why they dont are varied. some biz dont ...
yes, you could be potentially linking off forever ... so balancing it with what is important to the story ...
@renailemay example - Qantas media release re travel site launch. no link to the site http://twurl.nl/0v7cwz
@neerav exactly - & I'm writing a v basic blog post for the ones with the 1990s habits ... and there's HEAPS of em.
i did email them the day after they produced it & it was discussed a bit on twitter. maybe another go?
when i say it was discussed on twitter, i dont mean this time round - but at the time of the media release ...
& when u dream in tweets! i had my first tweet dream the other night - but i used to have email conversation dreams b4...
oooh that is so funny .. and disturbing. violating a blow-up doll without purchasing first is just so un-Australian
let me help u not unsubscribe from wotnews : ) there was a stuffup with summaries 2day - or is it another prob?
yes today there was some junk in it. Fixed. yr thoughts on daily email & site SRSLY of interest to our whole team.
yr 'right stuff' article is great http://twurl.nl/0mw4r1 - have added under 'ed's pics' on biz page http://wotnews.com.au/business
Cafe Citrus & Slumdog Millionaire - both fabulous!
im also try to gauge thoughts on biz sites e.g travel/finance/telco - the way they do/don't update their sites varies greatly
i mean to finish that with some biz dont know how
RT @waycooljnr: The Hype Machine' Zeitgeist 2008 - http://hypem.com/zeitgeist/2008/ - @fascinated you've outdone yourself, congrats
